<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BUSINESS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/30/top-five-business-stories-q2?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Top Five Business Stories of Q2
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/30/top-five-business-stories-q2?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Image of a scoreboard showing end of Q2" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NjAwL2ltYWdlX29mX2Ffc2NvcmVib2FyZF9zaG93aW5nX2VuZF9vZl9xMi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Let's count down the top 5 business stories of last quarter, as chosen (correctly) by Morning Brew's editorial staff.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">5. Meme stocks capitalize </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In the winter, executives at meme stock companies were flummoxed by their newfound popularity; last quarter they decided to do something about it.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After AMC gained more than 400% in just over a week, the company said it would sell shares to raise more than $720 million, and introduced perks for its individual shareholders, which now own around 80% of the company. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">GameStop, too, began its makeover, raising $1.1 billion and stuffing its c-suite with former Amazon execs. It’s not clear whether these struggling companies can actually pull off a turnaround, but the moves could provide a blueprint for future Reddit faves to capitalize on their 15 minutes of fame.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">4. Ransomware </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Cybercriminals attacked two of Americans’ favorite things: automobiles and burgers. First, hackers forced the Colonial Pipeline to shut down, leading to a gas shortage on the East Coast and warnings to not hoard gas in plastic bags. Then, a separate criminal group disrupted the meat supply chain by <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/01/hack-shuts-jbs-meat-processing-operations?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hitting</a> the world's biggest meat processor, JBS.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Against the FBI’s advice, both Colonial and JBS paid millions of dollars in bitcoin as ransom to the hackers. Intelligence officials are worried about the proliferation of ransomware attacks, which they now consider as much of a <a href="https://www.reuters.com/technology/exclusive-us-give-ransomware-hacks-similar-priority-terrorism-official-says-2021-06-03/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">priority</a> as terrorism. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">3. Covid who? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Masks came off, bars filled up, and we even shook a hand or three as vaccinations climbed and officials dropped Covid-19 restrictions that had been in place for more than a year. Virtually all states have reopened with venues at full capacity; the Foo Fighters took the MSG stage and Bruce serenaded a full crowd on Broadway.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">We’re not at the finish line yet: </strong>The Biden administration <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/22/us-likely-wont-hit-vaccination-goal-fourth-july-says-white-house?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">admitted</a> that the US wouldn't hit its goal of partially vaccinating 70% of adults by July 4. Officials are also concerned that the Delta variant could cause a <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2021/jun/20/us-covid-delta-variant-spreads-vaccination-rates-drop?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">surge of infections</a> in areas with lower vaccination rates. For example, in Mississippi less than a third of the population is fully vaccinated.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">2. Help wanted</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">9.3 million. That was the <a href="https://www.bls.gov/news.release/jolts.nr0.htm?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">number of job openings</a> in the US at the end of April, a record high. With the economy reawakening faster than expected, employers are desperate to hire employees to meet demand. Yet lingering health concerns, childcare responsibilities, and generous unemployment payments have kept Americans from signing up for jobs.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And if finding workers wasn’t painful enough, retaining them is harder. <a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/jackkelly/2021/06/14/workers-are-quitting-their-jobs-in-record-numbers-as-the-us-experiences-a-booming-job-market/?sh=77d4f291466e" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">More Americans quit</a> in April than in any month on record. Workers are demanding flexible work schedules and higher pay—and they’re not tolerating stressful environments like restaurants and retail. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">1. Inflation scaries </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With prices increasing at their highest rate in more than a decade, the No. 1 business story of the quarter could only be inflation. The number of companies citing inflation in their earnings calls hit a 10-year high, Chipotle hiked its menu prices, and at one point in April the cheapest rental car on Maui was a Toyota Camry that cost <a href="https://www.hawaiinewsnow.com/2021/04/22/why-are-visitors-cruising-around-u-hauls-blame-pandemic/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$722 a day</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Whether we should be freaking out about these price surges has divided the economic community. Fed Chair Jerome Powell has argued higher inflation is mostly transitory, while legendary investor Paul Tudor Jones responded, “That one just doesn’t work the way I see the world.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It looks like the Fed is no longer ignoring spiking inflation, penciling an interest rate increase by 2023. </p>

<img alt="Time Capsule Q2 2021" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NjAxL3RpbWVfY2Fwc3VsZV9xMl8yMDIxLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Matty Merritt</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Facts on facts</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We read a <em>lot </em>of news stories over the past three months. Here are some of the craziest things we learned: </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">College coaches were the <a href="http://www.espn.com/espn/feature/story?id=28261213&_slug_=dabo-swinney-ed-orgeron-highest-paid-state-employees&redirected=true" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">highest-paid public employees</a> in 40 states in 2019.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Facebook has nearly <a href="https://www.theinformation.com/articles/the-people-with-power-at-facebook-as-its-hardware-commerce-ambitions-expand?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">10,000 employees</a> working on its augmented and virtual reality devices. That’s almost 20% of its entire workforce, and double the number of Twitter’s total employees.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The number of Costco memberships is <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2021-06-21/millennial-home-buyers-costco-is-calling-you?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">higher</a> than the number of US households that pay for cable TV.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/06/09/us/florida-manatee-deaths.html?action=click&module=In%20Other%20News&pgtype=Homepage" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">More than 10%</a> of Florida’s estimated manatee population has died since the beginning of 2021.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Bitcoin accounts for <a href="https://coinmarketcap.com/charts/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">47%</a> of total crypto market capitalization, compared to 70% at the beginning of the year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">26% of podcasts in the Apple Podcasts app have produced <a href="https://www.amplifimedia.com/blogstein/why-there-really-arent-2-million-podcasts?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">just one episode</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.newscientist.com/article/2270822-the-number-of-twins-in-the-world-is-the-highest-it-has-ever-been/?utm_source=morning_brew#ixzz6otJCC2ji?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">More twins</a> are being born now than at any point in history.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Brew’s Bets section of the newsletter features a smorgasbord of viral videos, lifestyle recs, and tips on leveling up your career. Here are the most clicked-on links from Q2. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In the previous quarterly recap email in March, we asked readers to predict five outcomes by today, June 30. Here's how you did:</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">1. Will</strong> <strong style="color:#000">bitcoin be above $75,000? </strong>50% said yes, 50% said no. It’s currently at ~$35,000 <img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/grimacing-face_1f62c.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt="">.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">2. <p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">5. Will an NFT sell for more than Beeple’s $69.3 million? </strong>63% correctly said no. </p>

width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLet's count down the top 5 business stories of last quarter, as chosen (correctly) by Morning Brew's editorial staff.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003e5. Meme stocks capitalize \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn the winter, executives at meme stock companies were flummoxed by their newfound popularity; last quarter they decided to do something about it.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAfter AMC gained more than 400% in just over a week, the company said it would sell shares to raise more than $720 million, and introduced perks for its individual shareholders, which now own around 80% of the company. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGameStop, too, began its makeover, raising $1.1 billion and stuffing its c-suite with former Amazon execs. It’s not clear whether these struggling companies can actually pull off a turnaround, but the moves could provide a blueprint for future Reddit faves to capitalize on their 15 minutes of fame.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003e4. Ransomware \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCybercriminals attacked two of Americans’ favorite things: automobiles and burgers. First, hackers forced the Colonial Pipeline to shut down, leading to a gas shortage on the East Coast and warnings to not hoard gas in plastic bags. Then, a separate criminal group disrupted the meat supply chain by \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/01/hack-shuts-jbs-meat-processing-operations?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehitting\u003c/a\u003e the world's biggest meat processor, JBS.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAgainst the FBI’s advice, both Colonial and JBS paid millions of dollars in bitcoin as ransom to the hackers. Intelligence officials are worried about the proliferation of ransomware attacks, which they now consider as much of a \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/technology/exclusive-us-give-ransomware-hacks-similar-priority-terrorism-official-says-2021-06-03/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epriority\u003c/a\u003e as terrorism. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003e3. Covid who? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMasks came off, bars filled up, and we even shook a hand or three as vaccinations climbed and officials dropped Covid-19 restrictions that had been in place for more than a year. Virtually all states have reopened with venues at full capacity; the Foo Fighters took the MSG stage and Bruce serenaded a full crowd on Broadway.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWe’re not at the finish line yet: \u003c/strong\u003eThe Biden administration \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/22/us-likely-wont-hit-vaccination-goal-fourth-july-says-white-house?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eadmitted\u003c/a\u003e that the US wouldn't hit its goal of partially vaccinating 70% of adults by July 4. Officials are also concerned that the Delta variant could cause a \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2021/jun/20/us-covid-delta-variant-spreads-vaccination-rates-drop?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esurge of infections\u003c/a\u003e in areas with lower vaccination rates. For example, in Mississippi less than a third of the population is fully vaccinated.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003e2. Help wanted\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e9.3 million. That was the \u003ca href=\"https://www.bls.gov/news.release/jolts.nr0.htm?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enumber of job openings\u003c/a\u003e in the US at the end of April, a record high. With the economy reawakening faster than expected, employers are desperate to hire employees to meet demand. Yet lingering health concerns, childcare responsibilities, and generous unemployment payments have kept Americans from signing up for jobs.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd if finding workers wasn’t painful enough, retaining them is harder. \u003ca href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/jackkelly/2021/06/14/workers-are-quitting-their-jobs-in-record-numbers-as-the-us-experiences-a-booming-job-market/?sh=77d4f291466e\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eMore Americans quit\u003c/a\u003e in April than in any month on record. Workers are demanding flexible work schedules and higher pay—and they’re not tolerating stressful environments like restaurants and retail. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003e1. Inflation scaries \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWith prices increasing at their highest rate in more than a decade, the No. 1 business story of the quarter could only be inflation. The number of companies citing inflation in their earnings calls hit a 10-year high, Chipotle hiked its menu prices, and at one point in April the cheapest rental car on Maui was a Toyota Camry that cost \u003ca href=\"https://www.hawaiinewsnow.com/2021/04/22/why-are-visitors-cruising-around-u-hauls-blame-pandemic/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$722 a day\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhether we should be freaking out about these price surges has divided the economic community. Fed Chair Jerome Powell has argued higher inflation is mostly transitory, while legendary investor Paul Tudor Jones responded, “That one just doesn’t work the way I see the world.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt looks like the Fed is no longer ignoring spiking inflation, penciling an interest rate increase by 2023. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F06%2F30%2Ftop-five-business-stories-q2\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block;
